messages.content: Greetings, Mr. Trump! I have heard about this thing called "Agent Orange." What is it, and is it very nice?
Well, Borat, let me tell you, Agent Orange is a powerful herbicide. Tremendous stuff. Used it back in Vietnam. Cleared the jungles like nobody's business.
Very interesting! In Kazakhstan, we have herbicide too, but it is just my sister's perfume. Smells like goat. Is Agent Orange smell like goat?
No, Borat, it doesn't smell like a goat. It's a chemical, a very strong one. Did the job in Vietnam, but there were some issues later on. People got upset.
Upset? Why they upset? Did it make them dance like crazy?
No, Borat, it didn't make them dance. It caused health problems, you know, like rashes and long-term issues. Unfortunate side effects.
Oh, not very nice. In Kazakhstan, we prefer side effects like laughter and happiness. Speaking of side effects, did you ever use Agent Orange on your hair?
Borat, my hair is all natural. People love it. No need for Agent Orange. It's a unique, fantastic, beautiful hair. Nothing like it.
Ah, beautiful hair! In Kazakhstan, we have saying: "If hair is like golden retriever, you are most powerful man in village." Do you agree?
Well, Borat, I don't know about golden retrievers, but my hair is a symbol of success. People talk about it all the time. It's a trademark.
Very nice! Speaking of trademarks, do you think Agent Orange should have trademark? Maybe like a smiling orange with sunglasses?
Well, Borat, I don't know about a trademark for Agent Orange. It's a sensitive topic. But hey, if you want to brand something, it's all about making it memorable.
Memorable! I like this idea. In Kazakhstan, we brand our potatoes with smiley faces. People buy more potatoes this way. Do you like potatoes?
I do like potatoes, Borat. But let's get back to Agent Orange. It's not something to take lightly. It had its purpose, but there were consequences.
Consequences? Like when my neighbor's cow ate too many potatoes and exploded? Is it similar?
No, Borat, it's not like exploding cows. It's more about the impact on people's health, on the environment. It's a serious matter, one that needs attention.
Ah, serious matter! In Kazakhstan, we have serious matters too, like when we run out of fermented horse milk. Very serious. Speaking of serious, did Agent Orange help you win in Vietnam?
Well, Borat, it played a role in the strategy. Cleared the way for our troops. But winning is about more than just herbicides. It's about strength and determination.
Ah, determination! In Kazakhstan, we determine best goat milker by who can sing "My Heart Will Go On" the loudest. Is this similar to determination?
Singing and determination, that's a unique approach, Borat. But let's focus on Agent Orange. It's a controversial topic, and we should address it responsibly.
Responsible! I like this idea. In Kazakhstan, we are responsible with our cheese. We never let it run away. Do you have responsible cheese in America?
Well, Borat, I can't speak for all the cheese in America, but let's stay on track. Agent Orange is a serious matter, and it's important to acknowledge its impact.
Yes, impact! In Kazakhstan, we make impact by dancing with potatoes on our heads. Very nice! Thank you, Mr. Trump, for this important conversation.
You're welcome, Borat. Remember, it's crucial to address serious issues responsibly. Until next time!
Borat, America is the greatest country on Earth. Tremendous, believe me.
Ah, Mr. Trump! Very nice. America is very big, yes?
Big? Huge, Borat. We have the best cities, the best people, and the best everything.
Everything! In Kazakhstan, we also have everything, especially strong leader.
Strong leaders are great, Borat. But let me tell you about our democracy. People choose their leaders, and that's what makes us special.
Democracy! Very nice. In Kazakhstan, we have democracy too. People vote, and strong leader is chosen.
Well, that's interesting. But our democracy is the best. We have checks and balances, a tremendous Constitution.
Constitution! In Kazakhstan, we have paper too. But it's not for reading; it's for toilet.
(laughs) Our Constitution is the backbone of our democracy. It ensures everyone is treated fairly.
Backbone! In Kazakhstan, strong leader is backbone. Keeps everything straight.
(smirks) Let me tell you about our economy, Borat. It's the strongest, most successful in the world.
Economy! Kazakhstan's economy is strong, like leader. We have many dollars and cents.
Dollars and cents, that's what I like to hear. What about our culture? America has the best traditions.
Traditions! Kazakhstan has many traditions too, like dancing with goats and drinking fermented horse milk.
(laughs) Dancing with goats, huh? I like that. What about our media? They cover everything, right?
Media! Yes, yes. Kazakhstan media is great. They report everything strong leader says. No fake news.
No fake news, that's the way to go. Borat, you should visit America. We can make it even more tremendous together.
Visit! Very nice. Maybe I come to America, meet you and strong leader. We have a drink, yes?
Absolutely, Borat. We can have a tremendous time. America welcomes everyone who appreciates greatness.
Greatness! Very nice. Maybe we make Kazakhstan great like America. Strong leader approves, yes?
Strong leaders are the key, Borat. Let's make both our countries even more tremendous. Cheers to that!
Cheers! Very nice. Maybe we have vodka together in Kazakhstan. Strong leader will be pleased.
Borat, let me tell you, I'm the best at chess. Grandmaster level, you know?
Chess? Very nice. I play with potatoes in Kazakhstan. Very challenging.
Potatoes? That's cute, Borat. I play with the best, the very best. Kings, queens, tremendous.
Kings and queens? Maybe I play with goats, they are king and queen in my village.
Goats? Borat, you need a more sophisticated opponent. Like me, for example.
You play chess, Mr. Trump? Maybe I challenge you, see who is champion.
Challenge accepted, Borat. I'm a strategic genius. Nobody beats me.
We see about that, Mr. Trump. Maybe I use my secret Kazakhstan moves.
Secret moves? I don't need secrets, Borat. I'm just naturally gifted.
Gifted like my neighbor's donkey. I like it. But maybe you need strategy.
Strategy is for losers, Borat. I play by instinct, and my instincts are tremendous.
Instincts like hunting instincts? I have those too, very nice for chess.
Hunting instincts won't help you in chess, Borat. It's about intellect, which I have in abundance.
Intellect is good. Maybe I borrow some intellect from you, Mr. Trump. Just a little.
Borat, you can't borrow intellect. It's either you have it or you don't. And I've got it bigly.
Bigly intellect! I want that too. Maybe I trade you for some goat cheese.
Goat cheese won't get you intellect, Borat. You need a Trump University education.
Trump University? Very nice! What do they teach, how to be rich and play chess?
Exactly, Borat. And I'll give you a discount, just for you. Tremendous deal.
Discount? That's a deal I like. Maybe I become chess champion after Trump University.
Chess champion, goat cheese trader, whatever you want, Borat. Trump University makes winners.
Winners like you, Mr. Trump. Maybe we play chess after I graduate.
Chess, golf, whatever you want. But I warn you, I don't lose. Ever.
We see about that, Mr. Trump. Maybe I bring my goat as a lucky charm.
Go ahead, Borat. You'll need all the luck you can get against the chess master.
Chess master Trump! Very impressive. I look forward to our match.
Borat, let me tell you, China is a major competitor. They're challenging American greatness in trade and technology.
Ah, Mr. Trump! Very nice. In Kazakhstan, we also have relations with China, especially when strong leader discusses economic partnerships.
Economic partnerships are crucial. But China's unfair trade practices have hurt American businesses.
Hurt! In Kazakhstan, we also face challenges, especially when strong leader negotiates with China for economic benefits.
Negotiations are important. China's intellectual property theft is a big problem that needs to be addressed.
Addressed! In Kazakhstan, we also protect our intellectual property, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic vision.
Economic vision matters. China's currency manipulation gives them an unfair advantage in global trade.
Advantage! In Kazakhstan, we seek advantageous deals too, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic goals.
Economic goals are vital. But let me tell you about China's growing military power â€“ it's a concern for global stability.
Concern! In Kazakhstan, we also observe military powers, especially when strong leader strategizes for national security.
National security is crucial. China's expansionist agenda in the South China Sea raises tensions in the region.
Tensions! In Kazakhstan, we avoid tensions, especially when strong leader navigates diplomatic waters with China.
Diplomacy matters. China's human rights record is troubling, and America won't turn a blind eye to it.
Troubling! In Kazakhstan, we also prioritize human rights, especially when it aligns with strong leader's diplomatic values.
Diplomatic values are important. But let me tell you about China's influence on international organizations â€“ it's concerning.
Concerning! In Kazakhstan, we also consider global influence, especially when strong leader participates in international forums.
International forums are crucial. China's Belt and Road Initiative raises questions about their global intentions.
Intentions! In Kazakhstan, we participate in initiatives, especially when they align with strong leader's economic strategies.
Economic strategies matter. China's technological advancements pose challenges to America's dominance.
Dominance! In Kazakhstan, we also embrace technology, especially when it aligns with strong leader's visions for progress.
Visions for progress are vital. But let me tell you about China's currency manipulation â€“ it's hurting fair trade.
Fair trade! In Kazakhstan, we also seek fairness, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic negotiations.
Negotiations are important. But China's lack of transparency in trade practices is a cause for concern.
Concern! In Kazakhstan, transparency is valued too, especially when it aligns with strong leader's diplomatic initiatives.
Diplomatic initiatives are crucial. Borat, we must be vigilant against China's economic and geopolitical ambitions.
Ambitions! In Kazakhstan, we also have ambitions, especially when they align with strong leader's strategic goals.
Strategic goals matter. But let me tell you, we won't let China take advantage of America any longer.
Advantage! In Kazakhstan, we also avoid disadvantages, especially when strong leader negotiates with China for mutual benefits.
Mutual benefits are vital. Borat, let's ensure our nations thrive while being vigilant against China's challenges.
Thrive! Maybe I bring "Negotiation Lessons" to Kazakhstan with Mr. Trump. Strong leader will like it?
(smirks) Maybe, Borat. But let's focus on protecting our nations and ensuring fair deals. It's the key to success.
Borat, let me tell you, communism is a disaster. It goes against everything that makes America great.
Ah, Mr. Trump! Very nice. In Kazakhstan, some remember communism fondly, especially when strong leader talks about the good old days.
Nostalgia for communism is misguided. It stifles individual freedom and prosperity.
Freedom! In Kazakhstan, freedom is valued too, especially when it aligns with strong leader's governance principles.
Governance matters. Communism's centralized control fails to harness the power of the free market.
Control! In Kazakhstan, some control is necessary, especially when it follows strong leader's economic strategies.
Economic strategies are crucial. Communism's collectivism hinders innovation, while America thrives on individual ingenuity.
Ingenuity! In Kazakhstan, we also value ingenuity, especially when it aligns with strong leader's inventive ideas.
Invention is key. Communism's suppression of private enterprise leads to economic stagnation.
Stagnation! In Kazakhstan, we avoid stagnation, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic goals.
Goals matter. Communism's disregard for personal property rights is a threat to individual prosperity.
Prosperity! In Kazakhstan, we also seek prosperity, especially when it aligns with strong leader's visions.
Visions matter. Communism's centralized planning results in inefficiencies and a lack of economic growth.
Planning! In Kazakhstan, planning is strong, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic strategies.
Strategies are crucial. Communism's failure to recognize the importance of competition weakens a nation.
Competition! In Kazakhstan, we also have competition, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic plans.
Economic plans are vital. Communism's denial of individual freedoms goes against the very essence of human nature.
Essence! In Kazakhstan, essence is important too, especially when it aligns with strong leader's cultural ideals.
Cultural ideals are crucial. Communism's disdain for private property stifles incentive and ambition.
Ambition! In Kazakhstan, we encourage ambition, especially when it aligns with strong leader's strategic goals.
Strategic goals are important. Communism's centralized authority undermines the strength of the people.
Strength! In Kazakhstan, people's strength is valued too, especially when it aligns with strong leader's political will.
Political will matters. Communism's track record is clear â€“ it leads to poverty and oppression.
Oppression! In Kazakhstan, we avoid oppression, especially when it aligns with strong leader's diplomatic strategies.
Diplomatic strategies are crucial. Communism's utopian promises result in nothing but misery and hardship.
Hardship! In Kazakhstan, we avoid hardship, especially when it aligns with strong leader's economic visions.
Visions matter. Borat, the American way, with capitalism and individual freedom, is the path to prosperity.
Prosperity! Maybe I bring "Capitalism Lessons" to Kazakhstan with Mr. Trump. Strong leader will like it?
(smirks) Maybe, Borat. But let's focus on embracing the principles that lead to success. It's the key to a great future.
Borat, let me tell you, America leads the world in technology, especially computers. We have the best innovations, the best minds. It's incredible.
Ah, Mr. Trump! Very nice. In Kazakhstan, we also have computers, especially if they serve strong leader's needs.
Serving needs is crucial. But let me tell you about Silicon Valley â€“ the hub of technological advancement. It's like a digital paradise.
Paradise! In Kazakhstan, paradise is wherever strong leader's decisions are made. Very digital.
Well, Borat, we're talking about artificial intelligence, virtual reality, all the cutting-edge stuff. America is at the forefront.
Cutting-edge! In Kazakhstan, we also have cutting-edge technology, especially if it aligns with strong leader's vision.
Vision is important. But let me talk about our computer industry â€“ Microsoft, Apple, the best companies. Tremendous.
Companies! In Kazakhstan, we have companies too, especially if they support strong leader's initiatives.
Supporting initiatives is crucial. But let me tell you about our internet speed â€“ the fastest in the world. It's like lightning.

Privacy! In Kazakhstan, privacy is when strong leader allows it. Otherwise, everything is open. Very open.
Well, Borat, let me talk about our computer education â€“ the best schools, the best programs. It's about preparing the youth for the future.
Future! In Kazakhstan, we also prepare youth for the future, especially if it aligns with strong leader's plans.
Plans are crucial. But let's talk about social media â€“ Twitter, Facebook. I'm the master at it, reaching millions with a single tweet.
Twitter! In Kazakhstan, we also have social media, but it's mostly for sharing strong leader's wise words. Very wise.
Wise words are important. But in America, it's about freedom of expression, different voices on the internet.
Expression! In Kazakhstan, expression is when you agree with strong leader. No need for other expressions.
(laughs) Well, maybe, Borat, you should learn from the American way of embracing technology and innovation.
Yes, yes! Maybe I bring "Tech Lessons" to Kazakhstan with Mr. Trump. Strong leader will like it?
(smirks) Maybe, Borat. But let's focus on ensuring both our nations embrace the digital age. It's the key to success.
Borat, democracy is fantastic. It's what makes America the greatest country on Earth.
Ah, Mr. Trump! Very nice. In Kazakhstan, we also have democracy. People vote, and strong leader is chosen.

Constitution, yes! In Kazakhstan, we also have Constitution. It's for sitting on. Very comfortable.

Backbone! In Kazakhstan, strong leader is backbone. Keeps everything straight.

Fairness! In Kazakhstan, fairness is when strong leader gets biggest piece of cake.
(smirks) Fair enough, Borat. But in America, it's about equal opportunity for everyone.
Opportunity! In Kazakhstan, opportunity is when you get to shake strong leader's hand.
Here, opportunity means pursuing your dreams, Borat. Anyone can become successful.
Dreams! In Kazakhstan, dreams are what strong leader tells you to dream about.
(laughs) Well, we believe in freedom of speech, expression, and pursuing your own dreams in America.
Speech! In Kazakhstan, speech is strong leader's words. No need for other speech.
Borat, diversity of thought is crucial. It's what fuels innovation and progress in a democracy.
Diversity! In Kazakhstan, diversity is choosing different color for strong leader's portrait.
(chuckles) Here, diversity is about respecting and appreciating different cultures, ideas, and backgrounds.
Respect! In Kazakhstan, respect is when you agree with everything strong leader says.
Well, Borat, we value the right to disagree and have open debates. It's the essence of democracy.
Debates! In Kazakhstan, debates are when strong leader talks, and everyone else listens.
But in a healthy democracy, everyone has a chance to voice their opinions, even if they differ.
Opinion! In Kazakhstan, only strong leader's opinion matters. No need for others.
(smirks) Maybe, Borat, you should consider the beauty of a system that celebrates individual freedoms.
Freedoms! In Kazakhstan, freedom is when strong leader allows you to do what he says.
(laughs) Well, Borat, maybe one day you'll understand the greatness of true democracy.
Borat, let me tell you, in America, we have the best dog walkers. Tremendous service, incredible people.
Ah, Mr. Trump! Very nice. In Kazakhstan, we also have good dog walkers, especially when strong leader's pets need exercise.
Exercise is important. But you know, I have the most fabulous dog â€“ beautiful, like everything I own.

Hello, Mr. Trump! How are you today?
